intro: Scaphyglottis bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial herb with erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow with prominent, tooth-like structures at the base of the petals. Scaphyglottis bidentata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
